intro: Monnina bracteata, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often showy flowers. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Monnina bracteata is often grown in gardens for its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun.
